intro: Jacobinia atramentaria, commonly known as the black-leaved jacobinia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dark green, almost black, leathery leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
